Nice arbic Yemeni food....
Great food

After reading the reviews here, I went to this place to eat. People said the food was good. Let's start with the food: I ordered lamb roast, and it was served on a worn out plate wrapped in aluminum foil :O :O The server just left it there as if whatever. That plate seems to have been in use for decades!!! WOW!!! I felt hurt seeing the aluminum foil as how toxic foods I must be eating here with the money I am spending. There were two slices of lamb and a slice of lamb rib. The meat was soft but the smell was bad. I held my breath as I ate it. I also mixed the lamb with sauce to forget its smell. Because it was cooked too long, the taste of the meat was gone, practically.

I asked to replace the rice with naan. So, the Naab braed was partially burnt as you can see in the picture too. They were hot and tasted good. The naan tasted good, in fact that's the only thing that tasted good.

The soup was blend, I added the sauce in it to make it taste better. The salad was worn out and old. When did they get those salad supplies :'( I felt sad and hurt inside as I ate.

I came hungry and ate everything with the naan and sauce.

The salad bowl was so worn out, must be decades that they have been using it.

I could not believe that they served me on a broken tray!!! Broken!!!! WOW!!!

This dish I ordered cost $25 dollars.

The napkin caddy on the table was so dirty :'( the salt and pepper shakers were also worn out and dirty. You can see files of dust turned black everywhere.

The service was mundane, they just left things as if whatever!!!

You have to buy the water bottles as they do not serve water.

the appearance was ok with bright images that are dust covered.

I regret I went there and spent $27+ dollars.

I don't know how does this place runs like this ...

SPEND a few dollars to renew your plates, trays, and bowls. HOW POOR to be using these worn out and broken items to serve your guests!!! This is just awful.

alhamdulillah.

A True Paradise!

I'm thrilled to return to 2 Paradise Restaurant after a year, and I must say, they've taken their excellence to the next level! My previous experiences were already top-notch, but the improvements they've made are truly impressive.

I ordered two chicken wraps, and the flavors were absolutely delightful. The quality of the ingredients and the care in preparation shone through in every bite.
I highly recommend 2 Paradise Restaurant to anyone seeking exceptional taste and value. The team's dedication to continuous improvement is genuinely admirable.
This place is great and the food is absolutely amazing. One of my favorite  go to restaurants with friends and family.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Arth Aljanathain, and I can confidently say it's the best Yemeni restaurant I've ever had the privilege of visiting!

The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with traditional Yemeni decor that transported me to the heart of Sana'a. The service was exceptional, with friendly and attentive staff who made sure every need was met.

But the real star of the show was the food - oh, the food! Every dish we ordered was a flavor explosion that left us wanting more. The saltah, the kebabs, the mandi... everything was cooked to perfection and presented with love.

If you're a fan of Yemeni cuisine or just looking to try something new, Arth Aljanathain is a must-visit destination. Trust me, you won't be disappointed
Great Halal Yemeni restaurant
Tasty food! Fresh! And good portions!
Hey if you want back home style food this is the right place .haneetth or chicken the best .
Highly recommended. Really delicious food.

Good place

Great tasting food with great flavors.
Meet is tender & juicy.

This is a small restaurant that serves tremendous flavor. The food was absolutely perfection. I decided to have the rotisserie chicken with rice topped with vegetables and it came with soup (marag) and salad, side of lemon and Yemeni hot sauce. Very generous portion and delicious. Hands down would go back to Bronx just to eat here. The rice was fluffy and aromatic and the chicken was roasted well and juicy. Service was fast and nice. Lots of drinks to choose from including Yemeni products and a self serve tea station. Basbousa was sweet and soft.

This place is on point!!! All the food was fresh and made quickly. Took it to go but I have sat at this place and itâ€™s delicious. This is not a place you for atmosphere and all that junk is simply great food very nice people working there.
Loved there food and great customer service every dishes is delicious, bread was good too made with whole wheat which is healthy, very good food, will go back again,
Ordered fish and lamb on the phone, fought one hour traffic to get there and pick up. When we got home there is no fish. Disappointed. Lamb is average. Soup is very good.

Chicken with rice, Kabsa, kinda plain, no real flavor. Yellow rice with chicken, lots of tiny bones neck, ribs, and a drumstick. Soup was good, small coffee cup lol. Salad ok, dressing sucked. $16 for the order.
Tasty Yemeni foodâ€¦ friendly service. Iâ€™ve been coming here for years.
This was my first time eating Yemeni food. The food here was great and the owner was very attentive and hospitable. Definitely recommend this place
Exquisite Yemeni cuisine offered at an incredibly affordable price.

One of my friends from Yemen showed me this restaurant and Iâ€™m very thankful as it is one of my favorite restaurants in nyc. I have not been there since the virus but I plan on going back soon. The owners and manager are extremely  friendlyâ€¦

Wow this place is amazing. Good size portions, lots of menu options, quality good all day. Friendly service (some don't speak the best English, but it gets the job done). Really good people and they work hard to please!

We asked for takeout for lunch. Attention was fast and efficient. We ordered the lamb over rice, their oven vegetables with lamb, their fahsah with meat, and kabseh with meat. The dishes were all delicious - we particularly loved the super tender lamb, which falls off the bone very easily. Their oven veggies are super tasty, and their fahsah was something unique and delicious. Their fahsah and oven vegetables come with bread, while their kabseh is rice-based so no bread included. All of their Yemeni dishes come with curry soup (very delicious) and salad, along with their mildly spicy sauce. Their portion sizes are great, very fulfilling.

I'm definitely ordering from these guys again! Need to try their chicken next time - I saw their chickens, golden delicious, roasting in their kitchen behind the counter. Highly recommended for some Yemeni food in Morris Park area.

Delicious authentic halal Yemeni food. The best service and quality roasted lamb (so tender it melts in your mouth) (haneedth), delicious soup (marak), and awesome fahsa with a side of hulba.

If a restaurant is good I review them if they are not good I don't review them.

This one is one of the best.

Food is always good here. Best Hummus hands down. Highly recommend the roasted chicken over rice, the lamb over rice. And the falafel sandwich is to die for. Huge portions, rice dishes come with salad and soup. Cash only.

It was my first time eating Yemeni food, it was delicious. I had the chicken over rice with a side of salad and soup. Located in the section of Little Yemen, one block away from the 2 line train station.

I love this place. They have Hanid, Mandi and other Yemeni Foods.
I like their Salda with Roti which costs $15.

best yemeni food in the area, seating area is not comfortable and not clean.
Food quality is the best, price are reasonable compared to other yemeni restaurants in NYC.â€¦

Very friendly service, the complimentary mint tea with honey that is located in the back (self serve from a urn) was a delight. Their roasted lamb over rice is top class, meals are accompanied with a spiced broth and small salad.
Food is very good and is not pricey love it
Best food ever, I always go there enough though Iâ€™m not hungry. Their food is amazing.

This place owner lost his taste in the business but their food still can blow any ones mind when it's about having middle eastern food!!!

If the can fix their service mind .. they can go a thousan miles
My go to spot, theyâ€™re the best! Whether you get lamb and rice, roasted chicken or boiled chicken and rice or even a chicken shawarma sandwich, itâ€™s all amazing. Free unlimited tea too!
I will never eat at this restaurant again very nasty kitchen no health safety at all .plus mouses all over

This place is trash, the food is horrible to eat. I ordered food by phone , but unfortunately they delivered me something else.
I turned the food, because itâ€™s not what I ordered I couldnâ€™t even eat it.
But they refused to give my money back or replace the money with something else.
I left the food on the table and leave.
I donâ€™t forgive them my $30 I spent on their so-called food

Perfectly cooked rice, meat that was falling off the bone and just made fresh bread.

If you don't live in the Bronx you now have a legit reason to come here.
